title.narrative: Geothermal Development in Indonesia: Technical Assistance for Capacity Building Single Donor Trust Fund

description.narrative: The development objectives are to increase power generation from renewable geothermal resources and reduce local and global environmental impacts. The proposed trust fund activities will contribute to this goal by providing Technical Assistance (TA) for capacity building to Pertamina Geothermal Energy (PGE) to enhance its prospects for successfully undertaking a globally unprecedented scale-up of its geothermal resources by over 1,000 MW over the next few years. It will be implemented as co-financing with the Geothermal Clean Energy Investment Project, which was approved on December 22, 2010 by the Clean Technology Fund Trust Fund Committee and by the World Bank's Board of Executive Directors on July 26, 2011 providing PGE with US$300 million in loans to develop a total of approximately 150 MW of new geothermal power generation capacity, and help kick-start the company's overall investment program.
